translation: Sutra of the Mindfulness of the True Dharma, Volume 32

source_sentence: 元魏婆羅門瞿曇般若流支譯
translation: Yuan Wei translation of the Prajñāpāramitā-prajñāruci by the Brāhmaṇa Gautama

source_sentence: 觀天品之十一(三十三天之八)
translation: Chapter Eleven of the Contemplation of the Gods (Eighth of the Trāyastriṃśa gods)

source_sentence: 「爾時，天子念其天宮，還於天上。
translation: “At the time, the celestial prince was mindful of his celestial palace and returned to heaven.

source_sentence: 是時邪見外道諸婆羅門言：『此諸地，某天某天之所攝受。』
translation: It was then that the mistaken non-Buddhist priests and brāhmaṇas said, 'These lands are taken in by a certain god or goddess.'

source_sentence: 或作諸論或作讚歎，如是林中所住邪見外道諸婆羅門，見之敬重頭面頂禮，
translation: Likewise, the brahmans of heretical views who live in the forest venerate and venerate them by bowing their foreheads and faces.

source_sentence: 但觀其相而生敬信，不如實知是第二天。
translation: They simply observe their characteristics and give rise to respect and faith, not knowing that they really are the second.

source_sentence: 復生分別見：此天子處處遊行，身如火聚，謂閻浮提人身入火中，以是因緣，
translation: Again, they give rise to discriminating views: “This celestial being wanders about in all directions, his body like a mass of fire. That is to say, the bodies of the people of Jambudvfpa are engulfed in flames.

source_sentence: 生於善道，受諸天身。
translation: They are born in a good path and receive the bodies of gods.

source_sentence: 外道邪見諸婆羅門即作邪論，或自立宗，或自說因、自說譬喻，或作讚歎。
translation: The mistaken views of non-Buddhists and brāhmaṇas are to make mistaken arguments, sometimes establishing their own theories, sometimes explaining their own causes, sometimes using metaphors, or sometimes praising them.

source_sentence: 既自邪見，復為他說，令他受行，以火燒身，望生天上。
translation: Having held a wrong view of his own, he then taught it to others and caused others to accept it. He burned his body in the fire and was about to be reborn in heaven.

source_sentence: 如是不能如實見知，說邪因果，非實果報，身壞命終墮於地獄。
translation: Thus, they can't truly see and know, explaining wrong causes and results that aren't real rewards, and fall into hell at the end of their life when their body breaks up.

source_sentence: 「復次，邪見外道諸婆羅門住林中者，生於邪見。
translation: “Furthermore, those who have wrong views and non-Buddhist priests living in the forest give rise to wrong views.

source_sentence: 覩此天子從天來下向閻浮提，以遠見故，見不明了。
translation: He saw this celestial being coming down from heaven and heading for Jambudvīpa, but because he saw it from a distance he did not understand clearly.

source_sentence: 遙見天子從於莊嚴山峯來下，至閻浮提，後還天上。
translation: From a distance, he saw the celestial son coming down from the top of Mount Zhuangyan to Jambudvīpa and returning up in heaven.

source_sentence: 林中所住諸婆羅門見是事已，自生分別，謂閻浮提人投赴高巖，以是因緣，
translation: When the brahmans living in the forest saw this, they thought to themselves, “The people of Jambudvfpa have thrown themselves into a high cliff.

source_sentence: 生於善道，受諸天身。
translation: They are born in a good path and receive the bodies of gods.

source_sentence: 是故邪見諸婆羅門自墜高巖，欲求生天，復以此法為他人說，造作邪論或作讚歎，
translation: That is why the brahmans of wrong views, having plunged themselves into a high precipice and wishing to be reborn in heaven, teach others this doctrine so that they may make false arguments or praise it.

source_sentence: 說此邪法以為業果。
translation: He teaches that this mistaken teaching is the result of karma.

source_sentence: 以其邪見，妄說因果，身壞命終墮於惡道地獄之中，是名邪見。
translation: Because of their mistaken views, they falsely explain cause and effect, and when their bodies break up and their lives end, they fall into the hell of a bad destiny, which is called wrong view.

source_sentence: 「時林中住邪見外道諸婆羅門，見此天子從天來下向閻浮提，去之遙遠，
translation: “Then the brahmans who were followers of wrong views living in the forest saw this celestial being coming down from heaven and heading for Jambudvīpa, which was a long distance away.

source_sentence: 不見正色，但見大光猶如火色，妄生分別，便謂閻浮提人供養火故，身壞命終生於善道，
translation: They don't see the right form but simply see a great radiance like the color of fire, and they deludedly create discrimination, saying that the Jambudvīpa people will be born in a good path when their bodies break up and their lives end.

source_sentence: 受諸天身。
translation: They'll receive the bodies of gods.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 火是一切諸天之口，是故供養火者得生天上。
translation: Fire is the mouth of all the gods, so someone who makes offerings to fire will be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 作如是等妄生分別、不如實見，造作邪論或自立宗，或自說因、自說譬喻，
translation: They make such false distinctions and distorted views that are not true, creating mistaken theories or establishing doctrines of their own accord, or explaining causes and metaphors of their own accord.

source_sentence: 自作邪見，復教他人令入邪見。
translation: They themselves have wrong views, and they also teach others to enter wrong views.

source_sentence: 如是邪見諸婆羅門自無利益，令他衰惱，身壞命終墮於惡道生地獄中。
translation: Such mistaken views don't benefit the brāhmaṇas themselves, cause others to become depressed, and at the end of their life, they fall into a bad destiny and are born in hell.

source_sentence: 「復有邪見外道諸婆羅門住在林中，見此天子，妄生分別。
translation: Again, there are heretics of wrong views and non-Buddhist priests living in the forest who see these celestial beings and give rise to false discriminations.

source_sentence: 遙見天子不飲不食，時婆羅門作如是念：『閻浮提人不飲不食，以是因緣，
translation: Seeing the celestial beings from a distance neither drinking nor eating, the brāhmaṇa thought:

source_sentence: 身壞命終生於善道，受諸天身。
translation: When their bodies disintegrate, they'll be born in a good path at the end of their life and receive the bodies of gods.

source_sentence: 我今亦當不飲不食。』
translation: Now, I won't drink or eat either.'

source_sentence: 復教他人令學其法，造作邪論或作讚歎，說此邪法，以為業果。
translation: Again, he teaches others to study the teaching and creates mistaken theories or praises them, and he explains these mistaken theories as the result of actions.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，身壞命終墮於惡道生地獄中。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, they'll fall into a bad destiny and be born in hell at the end of their life when their body breaks up.

source_sentence: 如是外道不如實知，開惡道門。
translation: Thus, non-Buddhists don't really know and open the door to bad destinies.

source_sentence: 「若此天子或住少時，或須臾頃，於閻浮提過於百歲。
translation: “Suppose this celestial being stays in Jambudvīpa for a little while or a moment, or more than a hundred years.

source_sentence: 外道邪見諸婆羅門便作是說：『如是天子常住不動，不破不壞，造作世界，
translation: The non-Buddhist followers of wrong views and the brāhmaṇas said: Such a celestial being is always abiding, not moving, not breaking down or disintegrating, creating worlds.

source_sentence: 能壞世間。』
translation: They can destroy the world.'

source_sentence: 外道見之，便作邪論或作讚歎，說於邪因。
translation: When non-Buddhist people see this, they may make mistaken arguments or praise it and explain the causes of mistakenness.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，身壞命終墮於惡道生地獄中。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, they'll fall into a bad destiny and be born in hell at the end of their life when their body breaks up.

source_sentence: 如是無量不如實見，造作邪論，不如實見，自心欺誑，不如實見。
translation: Thus, they don't really see measurelessness, create mistaken theories that don't really see it, and deceive themselves with their own minds that don't really see it.

source_sentence: 「『心為惡蛇，　　愛毒周遍，　　螫人五體，
translation: 'The mind is a bad snake, pervaded by craving and poison, stinging people with its five bodies.

source_sentence: 虛生大悔。　　愛河廣大，　　五根津濟，
translation: The river of craving is vast and the five faculties are greatly relieved.

source_sentence: 此岸恐怖，　　彼岸安隱。　　見之妄解，
translation: This shore is terrified, and the other shore is peaceful.

source_sentence: 不如實知，　　是邪見人，　　墮於地獄。
translation: They don't really know that this is a person with wrong views who will fall into hell.

source_sentence: 是邪見人，　　非因見因，　　墮於地獄，
translation: A person who holds a wrong view and doesn’t see causes as causes Will fall into hell.

source_sentence: 顛倒見故。　　愚癡之人，　　迷於因果，
translation: Because of mistaken views, foolish people are confused about cause and effect.

source_sentence: 有獄所縛，　　受諸苦惱。　　業之果報，
translation: There are those who are bound by the bonds of hell, Who suffer all kinds of pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 則有生死，　　若如實見，　　則到彼岸。
translation: Then there's birth-and-death, and if they truly see it, they'll reach the other shore.

source_sentence: 愚人求欲，　　為欲所惑，　　墮於地獄，
translation: Foolish people who seek craving, Being deluded by craving, Will fall into hell.

source_sentence: 如蛾投火。　　人中持戒，　　奉修正見，
translation: Like a moth throwing itself into a fire, he observes the precepts among humans and follows correct views.

source_sentence: 而得生天，　　非由苦行。　　此諸外道，
translation: The non-Buddhist doctrine is that birth in heaven Is not due to ascetic practices.

source_sentence: 行邪見行，　　恃智邪慢，　　誑惑他人，
translation: Practicing wrong views and practices, Relying on knowledge and wrong pride, They deceive others with hatred.

source_sentence: 入於愚癡，　　黑暗大海。　　世間受苦，
translation: They enter the great darkness of ignorance, The great ocean of worldly suffering.

source_sentence: 以邪見故；　　非以苦身，　　而得解脫。
translation: Because of wrong views, it's not because of the body of suffering that they attain liberation.

source_sentence: 智者所說，　　調伏其心，　　燒煩惱山，
translation: What the wise one teaches, he tames his mind and burns the mountain of afflictions.

source_sentence: 則得解脫。　　修行正見，　　滅諸煩惱，
translation: Then you’ll attain liberation, cultivate right view, and extinguish all afflictions.

source_sentence: 見於實諦，　　則得解脫。
translation: Seeing the true truth, One attains liberation.

source_sentence: 一切外道，　　惑諸世間，　　無有寂滅，
translation: All non-Buddhists confuse the worlds Without any tranquility or extinction.

source_sentence: 不妄語處。　　世間外道，　　虛誑甚多，
translation: It is not a place where false speech occurs. Non-Buddhist non-Buddhist theories are prevailing in the world, With much hypocrisy and slander.

source_sentence: 百劫求之，　　無有少實。　　出世之法，
translation: For hundreds of eons I have sought it, Yet there is not a single thing real.

source_sentence: 皆是真實，　　世間言說，　　繫縛如毒。
translation: They are all true and real, spoken of in worldly language; Their bondage is like poison.

source_sentence: 愛心造福，　　得無常樂，　　出世之法，
translation: Their craving creates merit and attains impermanent bliss, And their transcendent ways are pure.

source_sentence: 則得常樂。　　不淨眾惡，　　因緣和合，
translation: Then they will attain permanence and bliss, Their impurity being mixed with evil.

source_sentence: 空有言說，　　而無誠實。　　如是妄說，
translation: Emptiness has words and explanations, Yet there is no truth.

source_sentence: 虛誑之人，　　墮於黑闇，　　可怖畏處。』
translation: A person who speaks falsely will fall into darkness, a place of fear.'

source_sentence: 「如是比丘觀諸眾生為心誑惑，以偈頌曰：「如是比丘實諦見之，說如是偈。
translation: Thus, a monk observes the mental anguish and confusion of sentient beings and says in verse, Thus, a monk who really sees them and speaks such a verse.

source_sentence: 云何眾生得真實知、得真實見，不起邪見？
translation: How do sentient beings attain true knowledge and truly see, and don't give rise to wrong views?

source_sentence: 邪見之論，自無實見，令他邪見。
translation: A theory of wrong views doesn't have a true view on its own, and it causes others to have wrong views.

source_sentence: 以邪見論，或自受行，或為他說，自墮地獄亦令他人墮於地獄。
translation: If someone holds a wrong view, either for themselves or for others, they'll fall into hell on their own and cause others to fall into hell.

source_sentence: 「時諸天眾觀察一切閻浮提已，乘諸天鳥，還歸三十三天，至於天宮，
translation: “Then the celestial beings observed all Jambudvipa and returned to the heavenly palace of the thirty-three gods, riding on the heavenly birds.

source_sentence: 向餘天眾，如前所說。
translation: To the other gods, it's as explained above.

source_sentence: 復於園林遊戲受樂，妓樂自娛，種種功德皆悉具足。
translation: They also played and enjoyed themselves in the gardens and pleasure groves, indulging in music and dancing. All their various virtues were fully possessed.

source_sentence: 一切眾寶莊嚴之處遊戲受樂，乃至可愛善業壞盡，從天命終，隨業流轉，
translation: All the places adorned with all kinds of jewels, where they play and enjoy pleasure, up to the point where their desirable good actions disintegrate, they die from heaven and follow the course of action.

source_sentence: 墮於地獄、餓鬼、畜生。
translation: They'll fall into hell, hungry ghosts, and animals.

source_sentence: 若生人中，常受安樂無有病惱，離諸衰亂，豐樂國土而於中生，受丈夫身，
translation: If they are born among humans, they will always experience peace and comfort without any illness or discomfort. They will be freed from all states of decay and confusion, live in a rich and prosperous land, and be born there.

source_sentence: 諸根具足，或為國王或為大臣。
translation: Their faculties are fully endowed, whether as king or minister.

source_sentence: 以餘業故。
translation: It's because of other actions.

source_sentence: 「復次，比丘知業果報，觀三十三天所住之地。
translation: “Furthermore, that monk knows the results of his actions and observes the land where the thirty-three gods live.

source_sentence: 彼以聞慧見：三十三天第二十七地名智慧行。
translation: They see by hearing wisdom: The Trāyastriṃśa gods' twenty-seventh ground is called the wisdom practice.

source_sentence: 眾生何業而生彼天？
translation: What is the karma of sentient beings that causes them to be born in that heaven?

source_sentence: 彼以聞慧見：有眾生大心持戒，修行善業，如實見於業之果報，心有信樂，
translation: They see by means of their hearing and wisdom that there are sentient beings who have great intentions to keep the precepts, cultivate good actions, truly see the results of action, and have faith and happiness in their minds.

source_sentence: 常行善業，捨於不善，其心質直，遠離惡友，乃至不與同路而行、不共言論、不與同住。
translation: They always perform good deeds and give up what is unwholesome. Their minds are straightforward and free of bad friends, so that they don’t travel the same path with others, speak together, or live together.

source_sentence: 如是善業悉遍修習，如煉真金。
translation: Such wholesome actions are cultivated universally like refining gold.

source_sentence: 於現在世，為一切人之所愛敬，以修善故。
translation: In the present life, they're loved and respected by all people because they cultivate goodness.

source_sentence: 若有比丘常修讀誦修多羅、毘尼、阿毘曇，如是比丘精勤修習，若晝若夜心不懈息。
translation: Suppose there's a monk who always cultivates recitation of sūtra, vinaya, and abhidharma, and such a monk diligently cultivates it, whether day or night, without stopping his mind.

source_sentence: 若夜闇冥廢其讀習，若有眾生敬重佛法及此比丘，施僧燈明，敬重法故，
translation: If there are sentient beings who revere the buddha-dharma and this bhikṣu but give lamps to the sangha because of their reverence for the dharma.

source_sentence: 敬信三寶，復行布施令得增長讀習之善。
translation: They reverently believe in the Three Treasures and further practice generosity so that they'll grow in the goodness of recitation and cultivation.

source_sentence: 若盛熱時，以扇布施，令無闇冥亦無熱惱，聞諸比丘談論聖法，心甚喜悅。
translation: When it's hot, he gives a gift with a fan so that there's no darkness or heat and no anguish, and when he hears the monks talking about the noble teachings, his mind is overjoyed.

source_sentence: 二種功德因緣力故，是善業人自利利人，身壞命終生於善道三十三天慧行之地。
translation: Because of the power of the two kinds of meritorious causes and conditions, this person with good actions benefits themselves and others for their own benefit, and when his body breaks up and his life ends, he's born in the land of the thirty-three gods' wisdom practice of the good path.

source_sentence: 生彼天已，以善業故，其身光明勝於日光滿足十倍，一切天眾之所供養，
translation: Because of his good deeds, his body’s light was ten times as bright as that of the sun. All the heavenly beings offered him offerings.

source_sentence: 無量百千天女圍遶供養恭敬，皆是天子先所親友，和悅含笑種種莊嚴。
translation: Measureless hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens surrounded them and offered support and respect, all of whom were former friends of the gods' sons, pleasing, smiling, and variously adorned.

source_sentence: 其身勝妙，色相威德皆悉莊嚴，離於妬嫉，互相愛敬，不離須臾，皆生歡喜親近天子。
translation: Their bodies were exquisitely beautiful, adorned with form and characteristics and mighty qualities. They were free from jealousy and respected one another; they did not leave each other for even a single moment. All became joyful and approached the celestial beings.

source_sentence: 手執蓮花或執金花，或有銀華、毘琉璃花、頗梨迦花，或雜寶花。
translation: They hold lotus flowers in their hands or gold flowers, or silver flowers, vaiḍūrya flowers, pārijāka flowers, or mixed-jeweled flowers.

source_sentence: 若金蓮花，白銀為莖，赤寶為鬚；
translation: Suppose it is a golden lotus flower with white silver as its stem and red treasure as its beard.

source_sentence: 毘琉璃花，真金為莖；
translation: The stems of the vaiḍūrya flower are made of pure gold.

source_sentence: 青寶蓮花，白銀為莖；
translation: The blue jeweled lotus flower has white silver stems.

source_sentence: 硨磲蓮花，青寶珠玉以為其莖；
translation: The stems of the lotus flower are made of blue jewels and pearls.

source_sentence: 赤蓮花寶，金剛為鬚。
translation: The red lotus flower jewel has a beard made of diamond.

source_sentence: 如是天女至天子所，以所持花散天子上，猶如盛夏降澍洪雨；
translation: In this way the goddesses came to the celestial being and scattered the flowers they carried on top of the celestial being, like rain pouring down in the summer.

source_sentence: 諸天女等，以諸寶花散於初生天子之上亦復如是。
translation: So it is with the goddesses and so forth, who scatter jeweled flowers over the first-born celestial child with them.

source_sentence: 「爾時，天子見諸天女心生歡喜，欲心即動，惡欲心發，從其座起，得未曾有。
translation: “At that time, the celestial beings’ minds were filled with joy when they saw the goddesses. Their thoughts of desire immediately moved and their thoughts of bad desire arose. They rose from their seats to enter this unprecedented experience.

source_sentence: 詣諸天女，踊躍歡喜，皆共和合娛樂受樂，歌舞戲笑遊戲娛樂，令此天子欲心增長。
translation: The goddesses who approached them all rejoiced, danced and jumped for joy. All the goddesses joined together to amuse themselves and enjoyed music, singing, dancing, playing, laughing, and frolicking, in order to increase the desires of these celestial beings.

source_sentence: 如是天女周匝圍遶遊於園林。
translation: Thus, these heavenly maidens are surrounded and roamed around in the garden.

source_sentence: 天諸園林眾寶光明，一切諸欲皆悉具足。
translation: The heavens, parks, forests, treasures, and lights are all fully endowed with all desires.

source_sentence: 於此樹下遊戲受樂，種種眾鳥歌眾妙音，與天女音不可分別，莊嚴欲具，
translation: At the foot of this tree they play and enjoy pleasure, with various birds singing beautiful sounds indistinguishable from those of heavenly maidens. They adorn themselves with all kinds of objects of sensual desire.

source_sentence: 花果充足，種種流泉蓮花河池有百千種圍遶園林。
translation: Flowers and fruit are abundant, and there are a hundred thousand kinds of flowing fountains, lotus-flower rivers, and ponds surrounded by gardens and forests.

source_sentence: 如是天子與諸天女遊戲娛樂，受無量樂，以善業故。
translation: Thus, the gods and goddesses are playing and enjoying measureless happiness because of their good actions.

source_sentence: 「是時天子復與天女，更詣異林，伎樂自娛，隨念具足，受天之樂。
translation: “Then the celestial being and his heavenly maidens proceeded to a different forest, where they enjoyed their pastimes of play and frolicking. They were provided with all kinds of delightful pleasures in heaven as soon as they thought of them.

source_sentence: 聖人所愛持戒之果，成就果報。
translation: The fruit of observing precepts beloved by the noble person accomplishes their fruitful retribution.

source_sentence: 如是天子，天女圍遶，復往詣於摩尼支羅遊戲之林。
translation: Thus, the celestial child, surrounded by goddesses and goddesses, went back to the maṇikāla's play forest.

source_sentence: 先舊諸天見此天子，皆出往迎，心生歡喜，猶如見於親族兄弟，安慰問訊，
translation: When the ancient gods saw this celestial being, they all came out to meet him and greeted him. Their hearts were overjoyed, just as if they had seen their relatives and brothers comforting and greeting them.

source_sentence: 共入林中，五樂音聲受天之樂。
translation: Together, they entered the forest and listened to the music of the gods with five kinds of music.

source_sentence: 如是天子受種種樂，復於摩尼支羅林中無量歡喜，目視眾色，心生喜樂。
translation: Thus, when the celestial being receives various kinds of happiness, he's also countlessly joyful in the maṇi-cāla forest, looks at all forms with his eyes and becomes delighted.

source_sentence: 其地園林皆以七寶而為莊嚴，金色寶衣莊嚴林樹，如是種種寶樹莊嚴。
translation: The grounds, gardens, and forests are all adorned with seven treasures, golden-colored jeweled robes adorn the forests and trees, and various kinds of precious trees are thus adorned.

source_sentence: 其地柔軟，無量飲食從河而流，目視如是一切眾色，眼甚愛悅。
translation: The land is soft and gentle, with measureless food and drink flowing down from the river. When one looks at all these various colors in the water his eyes are very delighted.

source_sentence: 如是初生天子與諸天眾娛樂受樂。
translation: Thus, the first-born celestial being and the gods are entertained and enjoyed by the gods.

source_sentence: 天子復詣毘琉璃地，共天女眾次第見於摩尼寶衣從樹而生，其色明淨，
translation: Again, the celestial beings came to the terrace of Vaiśravaṇa and together with the goddesses they saw jeweled robes grow from the tree in an orderly fashion, shiny and pure in color.

source_sentence: 甚可愛樂，微風吹動隨風上下，無量色蜂以為莊嚴，光色如燈。
translation: They are very pleasing, blown by the slightest wind and following the wind up and down; adorned with bees of infinite colors their light is as bright as a lamp.

source_sentence: 諸天見之，發希有心，生大歡喜，共天女眾往詣此樹作天伎樂，遊戲受樂。
translation: When the gods saw this, they became very joyful and went to this tree together with heavenly maidens to perform heavenly tricks and enjoy the pleasure of play.

source_sentence: 是時諸天於此林中心生希有，即於花中出天摩偷，具足一切上妙之味。
translation: The gods then gave rise to a rare thing in the center of this forest, and they produced a heavenly stealing from the flowers that had all the most wonderful flavors.

source_sentence: 一切天眾昔所未見色香味觸，見之皆生百倍悅樂，飲天摩偷上味之酒。
translation: All the gods who hadn't seen form, odor, taste, or touch in the past all became a hundredfold more delighted when they saw it and drank the heavenly moped of the best-tasting wine.

source_sentence: 天子飲之，共諸天女遊戲受樂，歌眾妙音，讚天王釋：『以天帝釋因緣力故，
translation: The celestial beings drank it, and together with the heavenly maidens they played and sang a variety of beautiful songs in praise of the king of gods:

source_sentence: 令我於此摩尼支羅園林之中受五欲樂。
translation: He causes me to experience the five desires and pleasures in this maṇi-cāla grove.

source_sentence: 味若摩偷，色香美味從樹花出，最為希有。
translation: The taste is like that of a maṇḍala, with its color and fragrance coming out of the tree's flowers, which are most rare.

source_sentence: 我今飲之，百倍受樂。』
translation: Now that I'll drink it, a hundred times as much pleasure will be experienced.'

source_sentence: 爾時，天子共諸天女以毘琉璃器盛滿摩偷天之上味，迭共相勸飲此天味。
translation: At the time, the celestial beings and goddesses filled a vessel of vaiḍūrya with the taste of the heavenly food that surpassed that of Māra and encouraged each other to drink the heavenly food.

source_sentence: 此諸天眾於人中時，布施持戒，今得如是勝妙色香上味果報。
translation: When these gods were present among humans, they gave alms and observed precepts, but now they've attained such a wonderful color, odor, taste, and fruitful reward.

source_sentence: 隨其本業上中下報，心生愧恥。
translation: Depending on the higher, middle, and lower rewards of their past actions, their minds become ashamed.

source_sentence: 「『眾生癡所使，　　飲於摩偷酒，
translation: 'Sentient beings are driven by delusion, drinking moped wine.

source_sentence: 現觀癡所繫，　　貪著於美味。
translation: They're now observing that they're bound by delusion and cling to delicious food.

source_sentence: 摩偷癡羂網，　　飲之至命終，
translation: He steals the web of delusion and anger, drinks it until his life ends.

source_sentence: 退墮於地獄，　　諸龍亦如是。
translation: They retreat and fall into hell, As do the dragons.

source_sentence: 若見觸嗅甞，　　令人心癡醉，
translation: If he sees touch, smells, tastes, and gnats, He causes his mind to be intoxicated with delusion.

source_sentence: 是故眾羂網，　　智者所捨離。
translation: Therefore, the net of all disputes is abandoned by the wise.

source_sentence: 見之生貪著，　　觸之則嗅甞，
translation: When they see it, craving and attachment arise; When touching it, smell and taste are produced.

source_sentence: 嗅之心貪味，　　著味為衰惱。
translation: The mind that smells it clings to taste, and attachment to taste is a debilitating affliction.

source_sentence: 一切繫縛中，　　無過貪嗜味，
translation: In all the fetters, there’s no fault of craving and enjoying taste.

source_sentence: 壞名聞色力，　　以其著味故。
translation: It destroys the power of name-hearing form because it's attached to taste.

source_sentence: 著味所迷亂，　　目瞢常惛醉，
translation: They're addicted to taste and are confused by delusion, and their eyes are always dull and drunk.

source_sentence: 心迷致癡荒，　　不知善惡法。
translation: Their minds are deluded, and they don't know the good and bad qualities.

source_sentence: 女人所輕笑，　　眠臥於糞穢，
translation: The woman smiled lightly, sleeping and lying in the filthy dirt.

source_sentence: 而無所覺知，　　不能自動發。
translation: But there's nothing to perceive, and it can't be self-arisen.

source_sentence: 酒能壞名聞，　　踰過於死畏，
translation: Drinking alcohol destroys fame and reputation, surpassing the fear of death.

source_sentence: 猶如飲毒藥，　　亦如死網羂。
translation: It's like drinking a poisonous medicine, and it's like the net of death.

source_sentence: 飲酒之為患，　　三十有六失，
translation: Drinking alcohol is a danger, and there are thirty-six faults.

source_sentence: 既知此過惡，　　應當速遠離。
translation: Knowing this evil, They should quickly get rid of it.

source_sentence: 大姓智慧人，　　為酒之所污，
translation: A wise man of great caste Is stained by wine.

source_sentence: 眾人所輕忽，　　如草隨風轉。』
translation: What's despised by the crowd is like grass that follows the wind.'

source_sentence: 「樹上有鳥名飲摩偷，見諸天子心生愧恥，即為天子而說頌曰：「如是天鳥雖是畜生，
translation: On top of the tree was a bird named Drombinī. Seeing the celestial beings, it felt shame and said to the gods, “In the same way, even though these heavenly birds are animals, they may be born in the realm of desire (i.e., craving).

source_sentence: 毀訾諸天，何況餘天。
translation: They disparage the gods, not to mention the other gods.

source_sentence: 此諸天子飲於天味，上中下味色香具足，如其善業願行種子。
translation: These celestial beings drink the taste of heaven and are endowed with superior, middling, and inferior flavors, such as the seeds of good actions, vows, and practices.

source_sentence: 飲已復詣陀羅殿林，於此林中欲行遊戲，聞種種音，心生歡喜，青優鉢羅以為首鬘，
translation: Having drunk the water, he returned to the forest of the palace of Tārā. Wishing to play and frolicking in the forest, he heard various sounds that made him feel delighted. His leader was blue utpala.

source_sentence: 天子天女共相圍遶，歡喜遊戲，心常念欲金色光明陀羅林殿。
translation: The gods and goddesses all surrounded each other, rejoicing and playing together, always mindful of the golden-colored, shining dhāraṇī hall.

source_sentence: 既受樂已，復往詣於彌伽雲林，既至彌伽雲林之中，見百千殿天鬘莊嚴。
translation: Having received the bliss, he went back to the Meghiya Cloud Forest and when he arrived there, he saw hundreds of thousands of halls adorned with celestial railings.

source_sentence: 「爾時，天主釋迦提婆乘伊羅婆那大白象王，共諸天子天女眷屬圍遶，
translation: “At that time, the lord of the gods, Śakra Devānām-Indra, riding on the great white elephant king Elāvana, was surrounded by celestial beings and goddesses.

source_sentence: 心生喜悅，為欲利益放逸諸天。
translation: The mind becomes joyous and happy, wanting to benefit the careless gods.

source_sentence: 時諸天眾見帝釋來，悉皆出迎，皆以頭面頂禮天主，於天主前出眾妙音，
translation: When the gods saw Indra coming, they all came out to greet him. All bowed their heads and faces to the lord of the gods, and before the lord of the gods produced many beautiful sounds:

source_sentence: 歌舞戲笑，歡喜叫呼。
translation: They sang, danced, and laughed, joyfully screaming.

source_sentence: 時天王釋以柔軟言，慰問諸天，在於伊羅婆那白象之上，告諸天曰：『汝以自業受於天樂，
translation: Śakra, king of the gods, spoke softly to the gods and comforted them. On top of the white elephant named Airāvana, he said to the gods:

source_sentence: 我今欲還歡喜之園，除阿修羅瞋恚、恃怙大力慢心。』
translation: Now, I want to return to the joyful park and remove the asura's anger and great conceit of relying on him.'

source_sentence: 時諸天眾白帝釋言：『天王！
translation: The gods then said to Śakra, 'O king of gods!

source_sentence: 我今亦當隨於天王，除阿修羅瞋恚憍慢。』
translation: Now, I will also follow the king of gods and remove the asura's anger and conceit.'

source_sentence: 時天帝釋告諸天曰：『汝勿急速，我今自能破阿修羅。』
translation: Śakra then told the gods, 'Don't go quickly; now I can destroy the asura on my own.'

source_sentence: 時天帝釋語諸天已，入歡喜園。
translation: After speaking to the gods, Indra entered the joyful park.

source_sentence: 見阿修羅在歡喜園猶如雲聚，漸漸增長。
translation: Seeing the asura in the joyful park, they're like clusters of clouds growing gradually.

source_sentence: 時諸天眾罵詈毀訾，轉增高大。
translation: The gods then ridiculed and disparaged him, increasing in stature.

source_sentence: 時諸天眾見其增長，罵詈不息，倍更增長，顏色醜惡。
translation: When the gods saw their growth, they didn't stop scolding them, doubled in size, and looked ugly in appearance.

source_sentence: 「帝釋見之，告諸天眾：『此阿修羅以汝瞋故，身增轉大，我當方便令離瞋慢。』
translation: Seeing him, Indra told the gods, 'This asura is angry because you're angry, so my body grows larger and larger, and I will skillfully free myself from anger and conceit.'

source_sentence: 「『不瞋能伏瞋，　　忍伏麁惡心，
translation: 'Not being angry can subdue anger, Tolerance subdues malicious thoughts.

source_sentence: 法能伏非法，　　光明破闇冥；
translation: Dharma can subdue what is not Dharma, And light destroys darkness and darkness.

source_sentence: 成實勝妄語，　　正語伏綺語，
translation: The true truth is superior to false speech, the right speech quells fancy speech.

source_sentence: 軟語勝惡口，　　能禁兩舌過；
translation: soft speech is superior to harsh speech, which can restrain the faults of duplicity.

source_sentence: 慈心斷殺害，　　布施除慳貪，
translation: A compassionate mind stops killing and harming, bestows charity to remove stinginess and greed.

source_sentence: 正念勝邪念，　　善念破惡念；
translation: Right mindfulness is superior to wrong mindfulness, Good mindfulness destroys bad thoughts.

source_sentence: 明能破無明，　　白日除黑闇，
translation: Light can destroy ignorance, and the white sun removes darkness.

source_sentence: 白月勝黑月，　　如是常得勝。
translation: The white moon is superior to the black moon, and thus it's always superior.

source_sentence: 智慧知真諦，　　勝於邪見欲，
translation: Wise and knowing the true truth, they’re superior to wrong views and desires.

source_sentence: 賢聖八分道，　　能破諸惡道；
translation: The eightfold path of the wise and holy can destroy evil destinies.

source_sentence: 如來四無畏，　　能破諸怖畏，
translation: The Tathāgata’s four forms of fearlessness Destroy all fears.

source_sentence: 憶念破忘失，　　智能破愚癡；
translation: Recollection destroys forgetfulness, intellect destroys folly.

source_sentence: 若住阿蘭若，　　則能破諸欲，
translation: If someone abides in a forest, they'll be able to destroy desires.

source_sentence: 須彌勝眾山，　　及以眾園林。
translation: Sumeru surpasses all the mountains And many parks and forests.

source_sentence: 大海勝涓流，　　及以諸河池；
translation: The great ocean is surpassed by the trickling currents And all the rivers and lakes.

source_sentence: 日光勝眾星，　　亦勝於餘宿。
translation: Sunlight is superior to the stars, And also superior to other constellations.

source_sentence: 法式勝無法，　　布施破貧窮；
translation: The pattern of teaching is superior to non-dharma, and generosity destroys poverty.

source_sentence: 質直勝諂曲，　　實能破妄語；
translation: Their straightforwardness is superior to flattery, And they are really capable of refuting false speech.

source_sentence: 吉能破不吉，　　火能燒眾薪；
translation: Good fortune destroys bad fortune, And fire burns up all kinds of wood.

source_sentence: 水能破於渴，　　食則能除飢。
translation: Water dispels thirst, And nutriment removes hunger.

source_sentence: 師子心勇健，　　勝於一切獸；
translation: The lion is brave and strong-minded, Surpassing all the animals.

source_sentence: 知足勝悕望，　　智者如是說。
translation: The wise one explains it in this way.

source_sentence: 悲愍者常勝，　　無悲為減劣；
translation: Compassion and pity are always superior, but the absence of compassion is inferior.

source_sentence: 智慧能調伏，　　智者如是說。
translation: Wisdom can subdue it, and the wise one thus explains it.

source_sentence: 眾惡邪見業，　　多作諸妄語，
translation: The actions of various bad and false views mostly create false speech.

source_sentence: 如是外道中，　　如來最殊勝。
translation: Among non-Buddhist teachings like this, the Tathāgata is the most distinguished.

source_sentence: 天勝阿修羅，　　以其法勝故，
translation: The gods are superior to the asuras, Because their teaching is superior.

source_sentence: 我當破一切，　　何況汝一身。
translation: I will destroy all of them, Not to mention your body.

source_sentence: 汝阿修羅使，　　汝勿生悕望，
translation: You messengers of the asura, Do not give rise to hope.

source_sentence: 今此師子座，　　智者所應住。』
translation: Now, this lion's seat is where the wise man should stay.'

source_sentence: 時天帝釋而說頌曰：「時阿修羅聞釋迦提婆說是語已，不復增長，以得聞於實語縛故，
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra then composed the following verse: When the asura demon heard these words uttered by Sakkadeva, he no longer grew in strength. Because he was bound by the bondage of hearing true words, he thought to himself, “How can I hear them?” The goddess replied:

source_sentence: 減劣不增，色力勇健悉不增長。
translation: They are neither decreasing nor increasing, and their physical strength and courage don't grow.

source_sentence: 見其劣弱，時有天子手捉其足，曳令下座，即時驅出天歡喜園。
translation: Seeing his weakness, a celestial being grabbed him by the legs and dragged him down from his seat.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋心生歡喜，復往詣於摩尼支羅所住之地，乘於伊羅婆那大白象王騰空而遊，
translation: Delighted, Indra the lord of gods went back to where Maṇicīla was staying and flew up into the sky on a great white elephant king’s mounted carriage at Airāvana.

source_sentence: 向於摩尼支羅之林。
translation: He's facing toward the maṇi śāla forest.

source_sentence: 所作已辦，與諸一切天子天女至摩尼地。
translation: Having done so, he'll go to the maṇi ground with all the gods and goddesses.

source_sentence: 摩尼地天見天王釋，皆悉出迎，頭面頂禮，修敬既畢，皆往詣於彌伽雲林。
translation: Seeing the celestial king Śākyamuni, the Maṇideva gods all came out to greet him, bowed their foreheads and faces, and after performing these acts of veneration, they all went to the Megha Cloud Forest.

source_sentence: 其地一切眾欲具足，柔軟廣博眾花遍覆，以蓮花枝用為宮室一切愛處。
translation: The ground is fully endowed with all desires, covered with flowers that are soft and wide and covered with lotus blossom branches as a palace for all cravings.

source_sentence: 釋迦天主共諸天女，種種樂音歌舞遊戲，娛樂受樂。
translation: The lord of the Śākya gods and the goddesses performed various kinds of music, such as singing, dancing, and playing, to entertain and delight them.

source_sentence: 乾闥婆王圍繞帝釋，歌眾妙音，讚歎天王，五樂音聲以為娛樂。
translation: The king of the gandharvas surrounded Indra and sang a variety of wonderful sounds to praise the heavenly king, and five musical sounds were used to entertain him.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋在於伊羅婆那白象之上，其象端嚴勝於寶山，行步進趣如動玉山，
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, was standing on top of the white elephant called Airāvana. The white elephant was as imposing as a mountain of jewels, moving in and out like a mountain of jade.

source_sentence: 其象鮮白踰於雪山，如春末時，日光照曜雪山之峯。
translation: The pure whiteness of the elephant surpassed the snowy mountains, just as at the end of spring the sunlight shone on the peaks of the Himalayan mountains shines brightly.

source_sentence: 如是天眾天子天女圍遶帝釋，遊於園林。
translation: Thus, these gods and goddesses surrounded Indra and traveled to the garden.

source_sentence: 其諸園林毘琉璃寶、白銀頗梨、因陀青寶、大因陀寶、赤蓮花寶、真金硨磲以為莊嚴。
translation: The parks and forests were adorned with lapis lazuli treasures, white silver crystal, blue incense, great incense, red lotus flower treasures, and genuine gold ornaments.

source_sentence: 釋迦天王共諸天眾天子天女遊戲園中，閉惡趣門，心生歡喜。
translation: The lord of the Śākya gods and the goddesses, together with their heavenly sons and daughters, closed the door to the evil destinies in the play park and rejoiced.

source_sentence: 雖得見諦，猶受欲樂，而常思惟眾生生死。
translation: Even though they have gained insight into the truths, they still experience desire and pleasure, yet they always contemplate birth and death for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 既思惟已，不恚不悅，觀諸樂受皆悉無常，破壞離散。
translation: Having thought about it, he's neither pleased nor displeased, observing that all pleasant feelings are impermanent and destroyed and dispersed.

source_sentence: 如是知已，內自思惟：『諸天退沒，因於自業，為何所至受自業果？
translation: Known in this way, he thought to himself: When the gods withdrew because of their own deeds, where did they go to receive the results of their own deeds?

source_sentence: 業風所吹，墮於地獄、餓鬼、畜生，流轉受苦而無伴侶。
translation: They're blown by the wind of karma, fall into hells, hungry ghosts, and animals, and continue to experience suffering without companions.

source_sentence: 一切諸天及諸天女皆悉如是，會當別離。
translation: All gods and goddesses are likewise, and the assembly will be separated.

source_sentence: 如是之業，大作樂具，戲弄一切愚癡凡夫。』
translation: Such actions create great instruments of pleasure and play for all foolish worldlings.'

source_sentence: 「『譬如虛空雲，　　為風之所吹，
translation: 'It's like a cloud in space that's blown by the wind,

source_sentence: 和合須臾散，　　生死亦如是。
translation: When they are combined and disintegrate in a moment, so is birth and death.

source_sentence: 時時如眾花，　　見人有生死，
translation: Each time it's like a multitude of flowers, They see people with birth and death.

source_sentence: 一切皆磨滅，　　如去來亦然。
translation: All of them are crushed and annihilated, just as they come and go.

source_sentence: 如是善業熟，　　則受於天樂，
translation: Thus, when good actions mature, they’ll experience heavenly bliss.

source_sentence: 善時既盡已，　　樂受則亦失。
translation: When the time of goodness has ended, The blissful feeling is also lost.

source_sentence: 時節如樹林，　　生時甚敷榮，
translation: The seasons and seasons are like a forest, Producing great prosperity at the time of birth.

source_sentence: 時節既過已，　　一切皆墮落。
translation: When the seasons have passed, All will fall away.

source_sentence: 諸天如樹葉，　　樹如受樂處，
translation: The gods are like leaves on a tree, And the trees are like pleasure groves.

source_sentence: 受樂則有墮，　　無有常樂者。
translation: When they experience happiness, there's falling, and there's no such person who experiences eternal happiness.

source_sentence: 猶如夏降雨，　　不住於空中，
translation: It's like when rain falls in the summer and doesn't abide in the sky.

source_sentence: 諸樂亦如是，　　念念不暫停。
translation: The pleasures are also like this, Each thought not ceasing.

source_sentence: 譬如孔雀鳥，　　風雲則出聲，
translation: It’s like the sound of a peacock’s song Produced by wind and clouds.

source_sentence: 風止聲則滅，　　天樂亦如是。
translation: When the wind stops, the sound ceases, and so does heavenly bliss.

source_sentence: 譬如以乾木，　　而置於火中，
translation: It’s like putting dry wood In a fire:

source_sentence: 天樂亦如是，　　為時火所燒。
translation: So it is with celestial bliss, which is burned by a fire at the right time.

source_sentence: 生已復歸滅，　　已經百千返，
translation: After being born, it returns and perishes a hundred thousand times.

source_sentence: 為愛之所欺，　　而無有厭心。
translation: Being deceived by craving, They have no disillusionment.

source_sentence: 癡愛網所覆，　　一切無免者，
translation: They’re bound by the web of delusion and craving, And there’s no one who can escape them.

source_sentence: 戲弄於諸天，　　受諸不善業。』
translation: They play with the gods and receive unwholesome actions.'

source_sentence: 「時天帝釋思惟是已，而說頌曰：「如是天帝釋愍諸天故，說是偈已，
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, thought thus and composed the following verse:

source_sentence: 乘於伊羅婆那大白象王，天眾圍遶奏諸音樂，出妙音聲，還善法堂。
translation: He rode to the great white elephant king Airāvana, surrounded by heavenly beings and musicians, produced a wonderful sound and returned to the hall of the fine dharma.

source_sentence: 以得勝於阿修羅故，心生歡喜，諸天恭敬到善法堂。
translation: Because he's superior to the asura, his mind becomes joyous, and the gods respectfully go to the hall of the good Dharma.

source_sentence: 摩尼支羅所住諸天，受欲無厭，受於色聲香味觸等遊戲園林，乃至可愛善業壞盡，
translation: “Furthermore, the gods who live in these heavens are not disillusioned with sensual desire. They experience pleasures such as form, sound, odor, taste, touch, etc., and so forth, even to the point where their delightful good karma disappears.

source_sentence: 從天還退，隨業流轉，墮於地獄、餓鬼、畜生。
translation: They fall into hell, hungry ghosts, and animals as they go along with the flow of karma.

source_sentence: 若生人中，生大種姓，受第一樂，端正殊妙，生在中國、正法行處，大富饒財，
translation: If they are born among humans and give rise to a great family, experience the first happiness, are handsome and marvelous, are born in China, practice the right Dharma, and are very wealthy and prosperous.

source_sentence: 子孫具足，壽命延長，眷屬和順，世間所有一切資具皆悉具足，一切眾人之所愛敬，
translation: Their children and grandchildren are endowed, their life spans extended, and their dependents are harmonious. All the necessities of the world are fully provided for them; they are beloved by all people.

source_sentence: 或為大王或作大臣。
translation: They may become great kings or ministers.

source_sentence: 以餘業故。
translation: It's because of other actions.

source_sentence: 「復次，比丘知業果報，觀三十三天所住之地。
translation: “Furthermore, that monk knows the results of his actions and observes the land where the thirty-three gods live.

source_sentence: 彼以聞慧見：三十三天二十八地，名曰眾分。
translation: They see with the wisdom of hearing that the Trāyastriṃśa gods have twenty-eight stages, which are called the assembly parts.

source_sentence: 眾生何業而生彼天？
translation: What is the karma of sentient beings that causes them to be born in that heaven?

source_sentence: 彼以聞知見：有眾生修行善業，正身口意，質直不諂，不惱眾生，常行善意，
translation: “Some sentient beings perform good deeds, with correct body, speech, and thought. They are honest, not hypocritical, not disturbing sentient beings, always acting with good thoughts.

source_sentence: 其心質直，離惡知識，親近善友，不近惡友，不共言論、不與同住亦不同行，
translation: Their minds are honest and straightforward. They avoid bad friends, associate with good companions, do not associate with bad companions, don’t talk or live together, and don’t act differently.

source_sentence: 常避惡人，惡人所友亦不親近。
translation: They always avoid bad people, and they won't be friends with bad people.

source_sentence: 親近賢善，聽聞正法，聞已思惟，心入於法——善、不善、無記——若有善法則便攝取，
translation: They become intimate with the wise and wholesome, listening to the true teaching. Having heard it, they reflect on it; their minds enter into what is wholesome, wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate. And if there is any wholesome dharma, they will take it in.

source_sentence: 知不善法則便捨離。
translation: Knowing unwholesome dharmas, they then abandon them.

source_sentence: 正念觀察調伏其心，不貪不欲，持七種戒，微細不犯，乃至小犯常懷大懼。
translation: He observes and tames his mind with right mindfulness, doesn't covet or desire it, observes seven kinds of precepts that are not violated even in their subtlety, and always harbors great fear for minor offenses.

source_sentence: 一切善業，如鍊真金清淨無垢。
translation: All good actions are like refined gold that's pure and undefiled.

source_sentence: 如是之人不殺不盜，布施修福，見殺害者，救令得脫。
translation: Such people don't kill or steal, give alms and cultivate goodness, and when they see someone who kills, they rescue them so they can be liberated.

source_sentence: 云何救於殺害眾生？
translation: What is the rescue from killing sentient beings?

source_sentence: 若有丈夫侵他婦人，為官所收，打惡聲鼓，從右門出，欲斷其命，無救無護，
translation: Suppose there is a man who attacks another’s wife and takes her into the hands of an official. He beats the drum in a loud voice and emerges from the right gate, intending to cut off her life but he has no help or protection.

source_sentence: 無所悕望，愁悴憂惱，欲至塚間。
translation: They had no hope and were overcome with sorrow and anxiety, and wished to go to the cemetery.

source_sentence: 將至殺處，如是善人贖令得脫。
translation: When they're about to go to the place of killing, such a good person redeems them so they'll be liberated.

source_sentence: 復行布施修諸福德。
translation: He also practices generosity and cultivates merit.

source_sentence: 云何善人修行福業？
translation: How does a good person cultivate meritorious actions?

source_sentence: 若僧住處，曠野無水，渴乏苦惱，如是善人，或為作井或為造池。
translation: If there's no water in the wilderness where the saṃgha lives and suffering from hunger and thirst, such a good person might build a well or a pond for them.

source_sentence: 若有水池，若井崩壞、若多細蟲，為僧修治，以諸細蟲置餘水中。
translation: If there's a water pond, or a well that breaks down or has many subtle insects, the saṃgha will cultivate it for the saṃgha and put the subtle insects in another water.

source_sentence: 如是微細皆不殺害。
translation: None of these subtle things are killed.

source_sentence: 若以漉囊，漉諸水蟲還置水中。
translation: If he uses a filtering bag to filter the water bugs and puts them back in water.

source_sentence: 是名不殺生。
translation: This is called not killing life.

source_sentence: 云何不偷盜？
translation: How is it not stealing?

source_sentence: 不以盜心取他草葉；
translation: They do not steal the leaves or grass of others with the thought of stealing.

source_sentence: 若曠野中種種果菜，故村聚落，疑他所護亦不故取，是名不盜。
translation: If there are various kinds of fruit and vegetables in the wilderness, old villages and villages that doubt what's protected by others and don't deliberately take them, this is called not stealing.

source_sentence: 是人修行一切善業，身壞命終生於善道三十三天眾分之地。
translation: That person cultivates all good actions, and when their body breaks up and their life ends, they'll be born in the thirty-three heavenly parts of a good path at the end of their life.

source_sentence: 生於右門，真金為座，白銀、琉璃、或以頗梨、或車璩寶、或赤蓮花寶以為其座。
translation: He was born at the right gate with a seat made of genuine gold, and it was made of white silver, lapis lazuli, or crystal, or chariot treasure, or red lotus flower treasure.

source_sentence: 青因陀寶、大青寶王、真珠之座，如是珍寶莊嚴之座而於中生。
translation: A seat made of blue indigo jewels, a great king of blue jewels, and a throne made of genuine pearls are produced in the midst of such precious jewel ornamented seats.

source_sentence: 既生天已，而自思惟：『我以何業而來生此？』
translation: After they've been born in heaven, they think to themselves, 'What actions did I take to come here and be born here?'

source_sentence: 即自念知：『我於前世作斯善業，供養眾僧。
translation: He then thought to himself, 'I did this good deed in a previous life to offer support to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 如是善業猶如父母，清涼之寶生於天上，決定受樂。』
translation: Such good actions are like parents, and the pure and cool treasure is born in heaven, which will surely bring happiness.'

source_sentence: 如是天子作是念已，即自現見業之果報。
translation: Thus, after the celestial son had this thought, he then showed himself the results of his actions.

source_sentence: 見果報已，讚歎善業，毀訾惡業。
translation: After seeing the results, they praise good actions and disparage bad actions.

source_sentence: 念本生已，念人業地，無量善業地如父如母。
translation: After he's mindful of his original birth, he's mindful of the land of human karma, which is like a father and mother in measureless good ground of karma.

source_sentence: 「『以善得人身，　　得已不放逸，
translation: 'With the good attainment of a person's body, he doesn't become careless after attaining it.

source_sentence: 造作眾善業，　　因是得生天。
translation: Doing good deeds, they'll be born in heaven as a result.

source_sentence: 人身甚難得，　　得已行放逸，
translation: The human body is very difficult to obtain, and after attaining it, he's been practicing carelessness.

source_sentence: 為放逸所迷，　　命終墮地獄。
translation: Being deluded by carelessness, they'll fall into hell at the end of their life.

source_sentence: 作三種善業，　　修行七種戒，
translation: They perform three kinds of good deeds and cultivate seven kinds of precepts.

source_sentence: 殺於三怨家，　　則受諸天身。
translation: If someone kills three enemies, they'll be subject to the bodies of gods.

source_sentence: 若人伏煩惱，　　未斷於愛心，
translation: If someone subdues afflictions and doesn’t stop craving,

source_sentence: 是人愛因緣，　　則生於天中。
translation: As a result of their craving, they're born in heaven.

source_sentence: 破壞於嫉妬，　　大苦之窟宅，
translation: It destroys envy and jealousy, the great hell of suffering.

source_sentence: 種種行布施，　　是人生天中。
translation: Giving in various ways is to be born in the heavens.

source_sentence: 觀他如己身，　　悲愍護眾生，
translation: Observing others as themselves, they compassionately protect sentient beings.

source_sentence: 慈心常調伏，　　是人生天中。
translation: Their compassionate minds are always disciplined, and they're born in heaven.

source_sentence: 觀偷盜如火，　　布施於一切，
translation: He observes that stealing is like fire and bestows it on all.

source_sentence: 以自修其心，　　是人生天中。
translation: By cultivating their own minds, they're born in heaven.

source_sentence: 觀他妻如母，　　常思惟真諦，
translation: Observing others’ wives as mothers, They always contemplate the truth.

source_sentence: 慾泥不能污，　　是人生天中。
translation: If the mud of desire can't be defiled, they'll be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 火從自心起，　　由舌鑽燧生，
translation: Fire is produced from one’s own mind. It is fuelled by the pressing of a flame with one’s tongue.

source_sentence: 若離此妄語，　　則生於善道。
translation: If someone parts with these false words, they'll be born in a good path.

source_sentence: 惡口破慈心，　　智者能捨離，
translation: Bad speech destroys the mind of kindness, but wise people can abandon it.

source_sentence: 常樂說軟語，　　則生於天上。
translation: If one always speaks soft words with pleasure, One will be reborn in heaven.

source_sentence: 觀綺語如刀，　　一切常遠離，
translation: Observing fancy speech like a sword, They are always far removed from all things.

source_sentence: 常行於正語，　　是人生善道。
translation: To always practice right speech is to be born in a good path.

source_sentence: 若有行善人，　　不行於兩舌，
translation: If there are people who practice wholesomeness and don’t engage in divisive speech,

source_sentence: 實說諦知時，　　是人生天中。
translation: When he truly explains the truth and knows it, he's born in heaven.

source_sentence: 若人護如是，　　七種身口戒，
translation: If someone guards these seven kinds of physical and verbal precepts,

source_sentence: 其人諦知戒，　　則生於天中。』
translation: Those people who truly know the precepts will then be born in heaven.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，天子念本生已，而說頌曰：「如是初生天子思惟既訖，說此偈已，
translation: At that moment, the celestial being thought of his former existence and spoke these verses: Having thus completed his thought, the celestial being born in heaven uttered these verses:

source_sentence: 觀本生處。
translation: He observes the original place of birth.

source_sentence: 念生處已，著欲境界，以前習故說如是偈。
translation: After mindfulness arises in the place, he's attached to the desire realm and speaks a verse like this because of his prior habituation.

source_sentence: 爾時，初生天子威德殊勝一切皆集，天女見之，速疾馳奔至天子所，猶如眾蜂馳奔蓮花，
translation: At the time, the first-born celestial prince was so majestic and powerful that they all gathered together. Seeing him, the heavenly maidens rushed to his place like bees chasing a lotus flower.

source_sentence: 諸天女眾馳奔天子亦復如是。
translation: So it is with the goddesses and other heavenly maidens who run away likewise.

source_sentence: 手中執於種種伎樂，琴瑟箜篌，鼓眾妙音。
translation: In his hand he held various kinds of musical instruments, such as the lute and harp that played in mysterious tones.

source_sentence: 是諸天女花鬘莊嚴，散以末香，手執花鬘。
translation: These goddesses are adorned with flower garlands, scattering powdered incense and holding flower garlands in their hands.

source_sentence: 復有天女散花供養初生天子。
translation: Again, there are goddesses who scatter flowers to make offerings to the first-born celestial child.

source_sentence: 如是天女以種種供養供養天子。
translation: Thus, these goddesses make various offerings to the celestial child.

source_sentence: 不可譬喻勝上天女或百或千，見此天子初生天中，心生愛樂，又見本所奉事天子死相已現，
translation: It cannot be compared with a heavenly maiden, whether a hundred or a thousand in number, who sees the celestial being born among the gods for the first time and becomes delighted when she sees him. She also sees that the form of death has already been manifested to the celestial being whom she serves.

source_sentence: 捨本天子，馳向初生福德天子。
translation: They abandoned their original celestial beings and rushed to the first-born, meritorious celestial being.

source_sentence: 譬如渴牛捨於枯池，走趣清水，此諸天女亦復如是，捨本所事，馳速往詣初生天子。
translation: Just as an thirsty cow abandons a dried-up pond and walks toward the clear water, so do these goddesses abandon their original duties and quickly go to the firstborn celestial being.

source_sentence: 「爾時，初生天子聞諸天女莊嚴之具出美妙音，欲心即發，何況見色及其音聲。
translation: At the time, the first-born celestial son heard the beautiful sounds of the goddesses' adornments emanating from their ornaments, and his desire arose, so he didn't even see form or sound.

source_sentence: 爾時天子見諸天女及聞樂音，恭敬供養，心生愛樂，悉忘本生，猶如隔於百千生死。
translation: At the time, the celestial princes saw the goddesses and heard the sounds of music, honored them with respect and offerings, became fond of them, and forgot their original birth just as if they were separated by a hundred thousand births.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以生天中放逸地故，性如是故。
translation: It's because they're born in the heaven of carelessness, and their nature is like this.

source_sentence: 爾時，初生天子為諸天女以諸欲法種種情態，不善觀故，欲心增長。
translation: At the time, the first-born celestial beings and goddesses gave various kinds of emotions for the goddesses because they didn't well contemplate the various forms of desire and dharmas, and their minds grew in desire.

source_sentence: 時諸天女說於種種欲心相應不淨之語，如是受於放逸之樂，天子天女互相隨逐。
translation: The goddesses then spoke various impure words associated with the mind of desire, and so they experience the pleasure of carelessness, while gods and goddesses chased each other.

source_sentence: 天女圍遶，一切諸欲皆悉具足，如是之樂昔所未得，今既得已，心生歡喜，
translation: Surrounded by the goddesses, they are fully endowed with all their desires. Such bliss has never been experienced before. Having attained it, they become joyous and think:

source_sentence: 為欲所牽，隨諸天女不得自在。
translation: Being driven by desire, they follow the goddesses and don't have control over themselves.

source_sentence: 時諸天女奉給天子，歌舞戲笑種種吟詠，鄙褻調話，令此天子心意迷惑，
translation: The goddesses then offered them to the celestial being, singing, dancing, playing, laughing, and chanting in various ways.

source_sentence: 隨諸天女所至之處，常隨其後。
translation: Wherever the goddesses arrived, they always followed them.

source_sentence: 欲網所縛如鳥在網，如是天子愛欲所縛亦復如是，隨其至處，天子隨之。
translation: They are bound by the web of desire like a bird in a net, and so it is with the celestial beings who are bound by their cravings and desires. Wherever they go, the celestial beings follow them.

source_sentence: 如是地處七寶莊嚴，昔所未見，見之愛樂。
translation: Such a place is adorned with the seven treasures that they have never been seen before, and they like to see them.

source_sentence: 既見此地，於此地中無量天衣天鬘莊嚴，受無量樂。
translation: Having seen this land, they'll be adorned with measureless heavenly robes and celestial garments in this land and experience measureless happiness.

source_sentence: 復往詣於度曠野林，作天伎樂，共此天子至曠野林。
translation: Again, he went to the crossing of the wilderness forest and played heavenly music, and together with this celestial child, he went into the wilderness forest.

source_sentence: 見此林中一切眾鳥，種種相貌以為莊嚴，其音美妙出種種聲，與諸群鳥遊戲娛樂。
translation: Seeing all the birds in this forest adorned with various appearances, their sounds beautiful and producing various sounds, they play and amuse themselves with the other birds.

source_sentence: 諸鳥亦復雄雌相隨，若至華中飲摩偷酒，雄鳥隨之，若於諸花亦復如是。
translation: The birds also follow each other, and if they go to the flowers to drink moped wine, the males follow them, and so it is with the flowers.

source_sentence: 若鳥遊空，雄雌相隨亦復如是。
translation: If a bird travels through the sky, it's likewise with male and female following each other.

source_sentence: 隨其至處，若食美果，鳥亦隨之，若復遊戲蓮花池中亦復如是。
translation: Wherever he goes, if he eats good fruit, the bird follows him, and if he plays again in a lotus-flower pond, it's likewise.

source_sentence: 於山峯中，二鳥雙遊，如是天鳥亦為愛網之所繫縛，將至異處，眾蜂之類亦復如是。
translation: In the midst of a mountain peak, two birds travel together, and thus these celestial birds are also bound by a web of craving that's about to reach a different place, so do the bees.

source_sentence: 群鹿麚麀相隨遊戲，亦為麀鹿欲網所縛，亦如天子迷天女色。
translation: They're also bound by the deer's web of desire, just like a celestial child who's lost his way into the form of a goddess.

source_sentence: 譬如夏時降雨滿池充遍盈溢，是諸天子為諸天女欲愛充滿亦復如是，愛欲繫縛。
translation: It's like when rain falls in the summertime and fills a pond with water, these celestial beings are filled with craving for goddesses and goddesses, just as they're bound by craving and desire.

source_sentence: 雖復舒緩，甚為難解。
translation: Even so, it's very difficult to understand even though it's spread and lazy.

source_sentence: 「『如是女欲網，　　繫縛甚堅牢，
translation: 'Such is the net of women's desire, which is bound and very strongly fettered.

source_sentence: 能令諸眾生，　　輪轉於有獄。
translation: They can cause sentient beings to transmigrate in hell.

source_sentence: 身縛尚可解，　　心縛不可脫，
translation: The fetters of body can still be released, but the fetters of mind cannot be freed.

source_sentence: 心既為欲縛，　　常受諸苦惱。
translation: Since the mind is bound by desire, it always experiences suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 羂網尚可斷，　　欲網不可燒，
translation: The net of anger can still be cut, but the net of desire cannot be burned.

source_sentence: 隨其所行處，　　不離三惡道。
translation: Wherever they go, They don’t leave the three evil destinies.

source_sentence: 羂網但縛身，　　愛網甚廣大，
translation: The net of anger only binds the body, but the net of craving is so vast.

source_sentence: 雖非是色法，　　能縛一切人。
translation: Even though they aren't form dharmas, they can bind all people.

source_sentence: 羂網縛眾生，　　尚可現覩見，
translation: Sentient beings bound by the net of anger can still show their angry views.

source_sentence: 如是愛縛心，　　求之不可見。
translation: Thus, the mind bound by craving is invisible when it's sought.

source_sentence: 初染生愛著，　　心著甚難解，
translation: The first defilement produces attachment, and the mind’s attachment is extremely difficult to understand.

source_sentence: 人為愛所縛，　　不能脫生死。
translation: A person is bound by craving and can't escape birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 女色大羂網，　　縛眾生六根，
translation: The great web of sexual misconduct of female form binds the six faculties of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 羂但縛一身，　　或縛或不縛。
translation: A dispute is only bound to one body, either bound or unfettered.

source_sentence: 若枷鎖杻械，　　聖說非為堅，
translation: If fetters, chains, shackles, and fetters are not said to be strong by the noble ones.

source_sentence: 癡人愛染心，　　繫縛甚堅牢。』
translation: A foolish man's mind is stained by craving, and his fetters are very strong.'

source_sentence: 「如是比丘觀此事已，而說頌曰：「如是比丘毀訾愛欲。
translation: “Such a monk observes this matter and says in verse, Such a monk disparages sexual desire.

source_sentence: 爾時，天子為愛天女，一切愛網之所繫縛。
translation: At that point, the celestial being is bound by all the webs of desire for goddesses and goddesses.

source_sentence: 將至園林，見種種林，甚可愛樂無以可喻。
translation: When he arrived at the grove, he saw various kinds of trees that were so lovely and delightful that there was nothing to compare.

source_sentence: 爾時，天子遊於花池，其池名曰白鵝之池，與諸天女至此池邊。
translation: At the time, the celestial prince traveled to a flower pond named White Goose Pond, and he went to the edge of that pond with the goddesses.

source_sentence: 天子天女遊戲娛樂，受五欲樂，種種樂音出眾妙聲。
translation: The gods and goddesses play and enjoy the pleasures of the five desires, and various kinds of music produce subtle sounds.

source_sentence: 眾分天子復往詣於金山之中互相娛樂，受五欲樂。
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods then returned to the gold mountain and amuse themselves among themselves, enjoying the five pleasures of desire.

source_sentence: 既受樂已，作如是念：『我今當與一切天眾詣善法殿遊戲受樂。』
translation: After he had received the pleasure, he thought, 'Now, I will go with all the gods to the hall of the good Dharma and play and enjoy it.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，與諸天眾詣善法殿，或遊虛空或乘鵝鳥、或乘孔雀、或乘宮殿，
translation: Having thought thus, he went with the gods and goddesses to the hall of the fine dharma; some traveled up into the sky, some flew on a goose or a lion’s carriage, some on a phoenix, some on a peacock, some on a palace.

source_sentence: 如是種種，詣善法殿，見天帝釋。
translation: Thus, they all went to the hall of the good Dharma and saw Śakra Devānām-Indra.

source_sentence: 種種伎樂歌眾妙音，至善法堂，爾時釋迦天王聞眾樂音，告諸天子：『大仙！
translation: Various kinds of music and songs were singing to the wonderful sounds as they arrived at the hall of the good Dharma, and when the king of the Śākyamuni gods heard the sound of the music, they told the celestial beings, 'Great sage!

source_sentence: 如是音樂，是誰樂音？
translation: Who is the sound of music like this?

source_sentence: 何地天眾來至於此？』
translation: Where did the gods of that land come here?'

source_sentence: 時諸天子聞是語已，皆出觀之。
translation: After hearing these words, the celestial beings all went out to observe them.

source_sentence: 既見天眾，還善法殿白帝釋言：『天王當知！
translation: Seeing the gods, he returned to the hall of the good dharma and said to Indra, 'You should know, king of gods!'

source_sentence: 眾分地天眾今來至此，奉問天王。』
translation: Now, the gods of the various parts of the earth have come here to ask the king of heaven.'

source_sentence: 時天帝釋告諸天子：『汝今應當發勝歡喜，以諸樂器作諸伎樂，出迎眾分所來天子，
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, then said to the celestial beings: You should now give rise to great joy.

source_sentence: 種種遊戲共相娛樂。』
translation: Various kinds of games are shared with each other to amuse themselves.'

source_sentence: 時諸天子聞帝釋勅，即奉其教，手執種種琴瑟箜篌種種樂器，種種天鬘莊嚴其身，
translation: Then the celestial beings, hearing the instruction of Indra, following his instructions, carried in their hands various lutes, harps, and instruments for playing music, adorned themselves with various heavenly ornaments.

source_sentence: 其身流出種種光明，身光鮮白晃曜照明，出迎眾分所來天子。
translation: His body emanated various kinds of light, and his body was shining brilliantly white like a shining luster, coming out to greet the celestial beings who came from all directions.

source_sentence: 二眾相見，和合遊戲，作諸神通，種種伎樂歌眾妙音，至善法殿。
translation: When the two groups of people saw each other, they played in harmony and created various supernatural powers, playing various kinds of music and singing wonderful sounds that reached the hall of the fine dharma.

source_sentence: 爾時，天主釋迦提婆坐百千柱寶殿之上。
translation: At the time, the lord of the gods, Śakra Devānām-Indra, was seated in a hundred thousand-piled jeweled hall.

source_sentence: 其師子座名曰得勝，天王坐上，安隱快樂威德光焰，百千天眾周匝圍遶，
translation: The lion seat was called Victorious. The celestial king sat on it, peaceful and blissful, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of celestial beings.

source_sentence: 受善業果，威德殊勝過於和合百日並照。
translation: They receive the results of good actions, and their authoritative qualities are so great that they shine together for a hundred days.

source_sentence: 雖處天宮而不放逸。
translation: Even though he's in the heavenly palace, he doesn't act carelessly.

source_sentence: 如是天眾既見天王，皆大歡喜過先十倍，即以頭面頂禮天王釋迦提婆，
translation: Having seen the celestial king, the gods were all overjoyed ten times more than before. They bowed their heads and faces to the heavenly king Śakra Devānām-Indra:

source_sentence: 「『天主憍尸迦，　　常護於世間，
translation: 'The lord of the gods, Kauśika, Always protects the world.

source_sentence: 法行常寂靜，　　境界莫能壞。
translation: The practice of the Dharma is always quiescent; No one in the world can destroy it.

source_sentence: 以法調世間，　　不以非法教，
translation: He regulates the world with the Dharma and doesn’t teach according to what’s unlawful.

source_sentence: 順法常安樂，　　違法受苦惱。
translation: Consistent with the Dharma, they'll always be comfortable, and they'll experience suffering and distress unlawfully.

source_sentence: 行法則安樂，　　修智亦如是，
translation: Practicing the Dharma is well-being, And so is cultivating wisdom.

source_sentence: 不侵不妄語，　　常受於安樂。
translation: He doesn't violate or speak falsely, and always experiences peace and happiness.

source_sentence: 若世間功德、　　出世間功德，
translation: If there are worldly virtues and supramundane virtues,

source_sentence: 此一切功德，　　天王悉具足。
translation: All of these virtues are fully possessed by the king of gods.

source_sentence: 怖者為作歸，　　苦者示善道，
translation: Fear is a refuge for those who are afraid, but suffering is to show them the good path.

source_sentence: 天王持世間、　　天人阿修羅。
translation: The heavenly kings preserve the world, gods, humans, and asuras.

source_sentence: 天王最殊勝，　　離諸不善法，
translation: The king of gods is most remarkable, Away from all unwholesome states.

source_sentence: 洗除三惡垢，　　受於三歸法，
translation: He washes away the three bad defilements and receives the teaching of the three refuges.

source_sentence: 如實知三業，　　行勝三菩提。
translation: Knowing the three activities as they really are, he practices the superior three kinds of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 雖生放逸地，　　不樂於放逸，
translation: Even though they are born in the state of heedlessness, They do not delight in heedlessness.

source_sentence: 天王持世間，　　法行離怨敵。』
translation: The heavenly king maintains the world, and his Dharma practice is free of enemies.'

source_sentence: 歌舞遊戲，以諸偈頌讚歎天王：「爾時，眾分之地諸天子等，勝智慧等讚天王時，
translation: They sang, danced, and played, praising the king of heaven in verses: At that time, when the celestial beings of the many parts of the earth praised the king of heaven,

source_sentence: 爾時釋迦提婆因陀羅觀諸天眾，善言慰喻，告諸天曰：『諸天子！
translation: It was then that Śakra Devānām-Indra observed the gods, comforted them with good words, and told the gods, 'Dear gods!

source_sentence: 莫行放逸。
translation: Don't act carelessly.

source_sentence: 若放逸者，則無利益。』
translation: If someone is careless, then there's no benefit.'

source_sentence: 時諸天子讚帝釋已，與天帝釋乘於虛空向眾分地。
translation: After praising Śakra, the celestial beings and Śakra flew up into space and faced the crowd's part of the ground.

source_sentence: 帝釋為首，諸天隨從，往詣眾分。
translation: Indra is the leader, and the gods follow him as he goes to the parts of the assembly.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋作如是念：『此諸天子心行放逸，不知退苦，我當示化退沒之相，
translation: Śakra, lord of the gods, thought thus: These celestial beings have been engaged in mental indulgence and are not aware of the suffering of regression. I should show them the signs of going back and forth by means of instruction.

source_sentence: 令生厭離。』
translation: He causes them to become disillusioned with it.'

source_sentence: 時天帝釋為於遊戲放逸諸天子等，化中陰有。
translation: At the time, Śakra Devānām-Indra had transformed the intermediate aggregate for the sake of playful and careless celestial beings and so forth.

source_sentence: 時諸天子戲遊園林山峯花池，時諸天子各各自見一切眾具勝相莊嚴皆見失壞，
translation: The celestial beings then wandered about in the forest, mountains, peaks, flowers, and ponds. Each of the celestial beings saw all the magnificent arrays of adornments that they saw destroyed.

source_sentence: 一切樂具亦皆磨滅，惶怖苦惱，身被繫縛，怖畏涕泣，烟焰俱起來遶其身。
translation: All their comforts are also crushed, terrified and tormented, their bodies are fettered, weep and wail in fear, and smoke and flames all rise up and circle them.

source_sentence: 閻羅王使之所執持，飢渴自燒，行大怖畏，火來燒身猶如燒林。
translation: The king of Yama, who was being held by an envoy, became hungry and thirsty and burned himself to death. In great fear the fire came and burned his body like a burning forest.

source_sentence: 閻羅使者醜惡可畏，種種惡色，手執刀杖、弓刀矛矟及捉黑繩、赤棒網羂，
translation: The Yama messengers were ugly and fearsome, of various bad colors, holding swords, sticks, bows, spears, arrows, black strings, nets, and red sticks in their hands.

source_sentence: 或有上昇或有下行。
translation: Either there's an upward or a downward path.

source_sentence: 時閻羅王所遣使者遍須彌山。
translation: The messenger sent by King Yama then pervaded Mount Sumeru.

source_sentence: 時諸天子見閻羅使從於天上縛諸天子，加諸楚毒罵詈撾打，遍身火起其焰猛熾。
translation: When the celestial beings saw Yama's messengers from heaven bind the celestial beings, inflicting painful and poisonous insults and scolding them, and their bodies were all ablaze with a blazing flame that rose high.

source_sentence: 時閻羅使手把刀戟，奮目大怒，互相告曰：『諸閻羅使！
translation: The Yama messengers then held their swords and halberds in their hands, raised their eyes with great anger, and told each other, 'The Yama messengers!

source_sentence: 速縛如是放逸天子，我當戮之，將入地獄，令其不復得行放逸。』
translation: Quickly bind such a careless celestial child, I will kill him and send him into hell so that he won't again practice carelessness.'

source_sentence: 如是大喚上昇虛空上須彌山，遍於諸地皆令摧壞。
translation: Thus, this great call rises up into the sky like Mount Sumeru and destroys all the ground everywhere.

source_sentence: 百千萬億那由他數閻羅使者、伺命之官、醜惡獄卒遍壞諸地及以山側，
translation: Hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of nayutas of Jambudvīpa messengers, commanders and jailers, as well as ugly jailers, destroyed all the earth and the sides of the mountain.

source_sentence: 遍於虛空，或上或下惱諸天子，語諸天子：『汝等所受五欲之樂、種種音樂，
translation: They pervade space, either upward or downward, to disturb the celestial beings and tell them, ‘Your enjoyment of the pleasures of the five desires and various music

source_sentence: 今何所在？
translation: Where is it now?

source_sentence: 汝等今為閻羅使者將詣地獄，受大苦惱。』
translation: Now, you messengers of Yama are about to go to hell and experience great suffering and distress.'

source_sentence: 若諸天子將墮地獄，則見獄火來燒其身。
translation: If the celestial beings are about to fall into hell, they'll see a fire coming from hell and burn their bodies.

source_sentence: 若諸天子有善業者，但見地獄，不見自身為火所燒。
translation: If gods with good actions simply see hell, they won't see themselves burned by fire.

source_sentence: 「時諸天子自見中陰被大繫縛。
translation: The gods then saw for themselves that the intermediate aggregate was greatly fettered.

source_sentence: 「『汝愛於欲樂，　　而不作善業，
translation: 'You love pleasure and desire but don't do good actions.

source_sentence: 是故得苦果，　　今日已成熟。
translation: That's why they attain the fruit of suffering today, which has already matured.

source_sentence: 汝若樂放逸，　　而行於非法，
translation: If you indulge in carelessness And practice what’s not the Dharma,

source_sentence: 至於臨終時，　　心乃生悔熱。
translation: At the time of his passing away, he felt remorse and feverish.

source_sentence: 悔熱喻火燒，　　亦喻於刀戟，
translation: Repentance and fever are metaphors for the burning of fire, as well as for a halberd.

source_sentence: 從於五根生，　　而還自燒滅。
translation: It arises from the five faculties And returns to burn itself out.

source_sentence: 於苦謂為樂，　　貪怨為親友，
translation: In regard to suffering, they are said to be blissful; craving and enmity are friends and relatives.

source_sentence: 觀放逸如是，　　是故應捨離。
translation: Observing carelessness is like this, so you should abandon it.

source_sentence: 放逸愛和合，　　為欲之所縛，
translation: Being addicted to the combination of carelessness and craving, they're bound by desire.

source_sentence: 三種大怨家，　　能破壞大樂。
translation: The three kinds of great enemies can destroy great happiness.

source_sentence: 憍慢近惡友，　　懈怠及貪心，
translation: Arrogant, approaching bad friends, lazy and greedy thoughts.

source_sentence: 遠離於持戒，　　是地獄因緣。
translation: Being far removed from observing precepts is the cause and condition for hell.

source_sentence: 持戒清涼觸，　　得報甚清涼，
translation: Their observance of precepts is cool and refreshing to touch, And their retribution is very cool and refreshing.

source_sentence: 愚人不修行，　　臨終生悔熱。
translation: Foolish people who don't cultivate practice will become remorseful and feverish at the end of their lives.

source_sentence: 見於他妻妾，　　而生貪著心，
translation: Seeing others’ wives and concubines, They become attached to their desires.

source_sentence: 飲酒行劫盜，　　因此墮地獄。
translation: Drinking alcohol and engaging in robbery, they'll fall into hell as a result.

source_sentence: 惡口親惡友，　　邪見無正信，
translation: They speak harshly, associate with bad friends, hold wrong views and lack right faith.

source_sentence: 其心多躁擾，　　此法失人身。
translation: Their minds are often agitated, and this is how they lose their human body.

source_sentence: 貪心及綺語，　　妄語無誠信，
translation: The mind of greed and fancy speech, lying and lacking faith.

source_sentence: 今世若後世，　　無有少安樂。
translation: In this world and the next, There will be no little peace and happiness.

source_sentence: 遠離於善友，　　親近惡知識，
translation: Being far removed from good friends and associating with bad companions,

source_sentence: 根本無利益，　　不信業果報。
translation: Their roots lack benefit, and they don't believe in the results of actions.

source_sentence: 不識業果報，　　苦樂非眾生，
translation: They don’t know the results of actions, pain and pleasure are not sentient beings.

source_sentence: 是人迷因果，　　臨終生悔熱。
translation: That person is deluded about cause and effect, and at the end of life he becomes remorseful and feverish.

source_sentence: 若人常妄語，　　恃智生憍慢，
translation: If someone always speaks falsely and relies on knowledge to give rise to arrogance,

source_sentence: 後得大衰惱，　　乃覺其業果。
translation: Later, they'll attain great debilitation, and then they'll realize the results of their actions.

source_sentence: 若流轉世間，　　具受諸苦惱，
translation: If the world of transmigration is full of suffering and distress,

source_sentence: 皆由無明力，　　大仙如是說。』
translation: It's all because of the power of ignorance, and the great sage thus explains it.'

source_sentence: 爾時，獄卒閻羅王使為此天子而說頌曰：「爾時，釋迦提婆因陀羅化作如是閻羅使者，
translation: It was then that the jailer, the messenger of King Yama, spoke these verses to the celestial being: At that time the apparitional messenger Śakra Devānām-Indra manifested himself like this.

source_sentence: 為諸天子中有說法，折伏呵責。
translation: He teaches the Dharma for the sake of the gods, subduing and reprimanding them.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋復為諸天眾示現變化。
translation: Śakra then again manifested his transformation for the gods.

source_sentence: 若諸天子有先世業應墮畜生，示於無量種種業相，如印印泥。
translation: If the celestial beings had done actions in previous lives, they would have fallen into the animal kingdom and shown measureless forms of actions like mud seals.

source_sentence: 中陰之相互相殘害，共相食噉，生大怖畏，令諸天子皆悉見之。
translation: The intermediate aggregates are mutually harming each other, eating and drinking together, causing great fear that causes the celestial beings to see them all.

source_sentence: 若諸天子無畜生業，但見畜生互相殘害，不見自身作畜生形。
translation: If the gods don't do anything like animals, they simply see animals that harm each other and don't see themselves in the form of an animal.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋復為放逸諸天子等，示化中陰。
translation: Śakra then again showed the intermediate aggregate of transformation to careless celestial beings and so forth.

source_sentence: 若諸天子當生餓鬼，為於飢渴焚燒其身，長髮覆面，其形醜惡。
translation: If the gods were to give birth to hungry ghosts, their bodies would be burned by hunger and thirst, covering their faces for a long time, and their forms would be ugly.

source_sentence: 此諸天子見虛空中，烏鵄諸鳥來啄其眼及耳鼻舌。
translation: When these celestial beings see the sky, crows and birds come to peck at their eyes, ears, nose, and tongue.

source_sentence: 是時天眾見向所化如是惡相，生大怖畏。
translation: At the time, the gods saw such bad appearances of what they were transforming and became greatly frightened.

source_sentence: 餘天見已，白帝釋言：『釋迦天王！
translation: Seeing them, the other gods said to Indra, 'Śākyamuni!

source_sentence: 何故捨諸天子而自止住？
translation: Why do they abandon the celestial beings and abide on their own?

source_sentence: 此諸天子皆被繫縛，或阿修羅、或餘惡人將之欲去，遍須彌山一切諸地。
translation: These celestial beings are all bound, and some asuras or other bad people will want to leave them, pervading all the grounds of Mount Sumeru.

source_sentence: 我亦曾與阿修羅鬪，未曾覩見如是惡相。
translation: I've also fought with the asura, and I've never seen such bad appearances before.

source_sentence: 又阿修羅及其軍眾未曾俱來至此天中，云何世間失正法耶？
translation: Also, since the asura and their armies have never come to this heaven together, how did the world lose the right teaching?

source_sentence: 不孝父母耶？
translation: Aren't they filial to their parents?

source_sentence: 不敬沙門、婆羅門耶？
translation: Do you not revere the śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas?

source_sentence: 不敬耆舊長宿耶？
translation: Doesn't he venerate the long-abiding senior citizens?

source_sentence: 天王！
translation: O king of gods!

source_sentence: 今諸世間不供養如來及法僧耶？
translation: Why don't the world now make offerings to the Tathāgata and Dharma and saṃgha?

source_sentence: 不知因果、不知真諦耶？
translation: Do you not know the law of cause and effect or the true truth?

source_sentence: 如護世天王常說此法，今閻浮提不修行耶？
translation: Just as the world-protecting celestial king always taught this teaching, isn't it cultivated in Jambudvīpa now?

source_sentence: 今諸天眾皆被惱亂。
translation: Now, all the gods and goddesses are disturbed.

source_sentence: 天王！
translation: O king of gods!

source_sentence: 何故不嚴器仗，乘於伊那大龍象王，身服鎧鉀，擊大戰鼓莊嚴鬪戰？』
translation: Why don't you adorn your weapons and ride on the great dragon elephant king of Īna, wear armor and ambrosia, and beat the great battle drum to adorn the fight?'

source_sentence: 有諸天眾，天主同業，向天王釋作如是說。
translation: There are gods and goddesses who share the same karma, and they explain it to the king of gods in this way.

source_sentence: 復有諸天覩此希有未曾見事，心生厭離，極大恐怖，諸根振動，歸依帝釋作如是言：『唯願天王救護我等。
translation: Again, some gods resented this unprecedented sight and became disgusted with great fear. Their faculties trembled and they relied on Indra to say these words:

source_sentence: 此諸天眾所住之地，悉為阿修羅之所劫奪。
translation: The land where these gods live is completely taken over by the asura.

source_sentence: 未曾見此阿修羅等可畏之身如是怖畏。』
translation: I've never seen such a fearful body like this as an asura.'

source_sentence: 諸天子等皆向帝釋作如是說。
translation: The gods and so forth all spoke to Indra in this way.

source_sentence: 復有天子見是化已，向善法殿速疾馳奔，取諸器仗鬪戰之具。
translation: Again, some celestial beings saw this apparition and quickly ran toward the hall of the fine dharma to get weapons and fighting implements for battle.

source_sentence: 復有天子詣雜殿林，取諸鬪具向閻羅使若打若捉，不能加害。
translation: Again, there are celestial beings who go to the miscellaneous palace and take their fighting implements and send them to Yama to be beaten or captured, but they can't harm them.

source_sentence: 譬如鏡中所見色像，不可捉持、不可打害。
translation: It's like a colored image seen in a mirror that can't be grasped or struck.

source_sentence: 如是天王示如斯化。
translation: Thus, the king of gods shows such a transformation.

source_sentence: 「是時天主釋迦提婆復示天子——化阿修羅——勝於羅睺、勇健阿修羅等，
translation: “Then the lord of the gods, Śakra Devānām-Indra, the prince of gods, showed the apparitional asuras how to outshine Rāhu and other heroic asuras.

source_sentence: 被縛撾打、斫刺罵詈，悲泣憂惱，如諸天子化受苦惱。
translation: They're bound, beaten, tortured, harmed, and scolded, weeping and grieved, like the gods who are transformed into suffering and being tormented.

source_sentence: 時諸天子見阿修羅受大劇苦，百千萬倍過諸天子。
translation: The gods then saw that the asura was suffering greatly, a hundred million times more painful than the gods.

source_sentence: 時諸天子見阿修羅受大苦惱，未曾所見，生大怖畏。
translation: The gods then saw that the asura was suffering great pain and distress, had never seen it before, and became very frightened.

source_sentence: 復往詣於釋迦天王，白天王言：『我今不知是何丈夫有斯大力，皆能繫縛諸阿修羅王——羅睺阿修羅王、勇健阿修羅王——繫撾打棒、斫刺罵詈？
translation: Again, he went to the king of the Śākyamuni gods and said, 'Now, I don't know which man has such great strength that they can bind the asura kings Rāhu and Yongjian asura kings who are bound by beating, stabbing, and scolding them.

source_sentence: 云何有此未曾有事，令諸天子身毛皆竪？
translation: How could there be such an unprecedented event that would cause the celestial beings' hair on their bodies to stand on end?

source_sentence: 唯願天王為我說之，我今亦畏，得此衰惱。
translation: All we ask, king of gods, is that you tell me about it. Now I am also afraid to experience this misfortune.

source_sentence: 天王！
translation: O king of gods!

source_sentence: 何者為，知不耶？
translation: What's the knowledge of knowing and not?

source_sentence: 諸天之眾及阿修羅皆悉破壞，一切世間恐皆摧滅。
translation: The gods and asuras will all be destroyed, and all the worlds will surely be destroyed.

source_sentence: 天王若知，願為我說。
translation: If you, king of gods, know this, please tell me about it.

source_sentence: 釋迦天王若不知，若不知者願善思惟。』
translation: If the king of the Śākyamuni gods don't know it, or if they don't know it, may they well contemplate it.'
